channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Who is Reza Pahlavi, the exiled crown prince encouraging demonstrations across Iran?
item.description: In exile for nearly 50 years, Iran's Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi has issued calls urging Iranians to join protests sweeping the country. But support for him may not be clear cut.
item.content:encoded:
In exile for nearly 50 years, Iran's Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi has issued calls urging Iranians to join protests sweeping the country. But support for him may not be clear cut.

(Image credit: Thomas Padilla)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: US launches new retaliatory strikes against ISIS in Syria after deadly ambush
item.description: The U.S. has launched another round of strikes against the Islamic State in Syria. This follows last month's ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and an American civilian interpreter.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. has launched another round of strikes against the Islamic State in Syria. This follows last month's ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and an American civilian interpreter.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Europe alarmed by Trump's Greenland push
item.description: Europe is increasingly alarmed by Trump's talk of annexing Greenland, an autonomous Danish territory in the EU and NATO, especially after the U.S. incursion in Venezuela last weekend.
item.content:encoded: Europe is increasingly alarmed by Trump's talk of annexing Greenland, an autonomous Danish territory in the EU and NATO, especially after the U.S. incursion in Venezuela last weekend.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: How does NPR report on Venezuela?
item.description: Eyder Peralta, NPR international correspondent, on racing to the Venezuela border after the U.S. captured Nicolás Maduro, and the obstacles keeping journalists from getting into the country.
item.content:encoded: Eyder Peralta, NPR international correspondent, on racing to the Venezuela border after the U.S. captured Nicolás Maduro, and the obstacles keeping journalists from getting into the country.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Britain executed Ruth Ellis in 1955. Now her granddaughter wants justice
item.description: In 1955, Ruth Ellis was hanged for killing her abusive partner. Her case became one of the catalysts for abolishing the death penalty in the UK, and 70 years later her family is seeking a posthumous pardon.
item.content:encoded: In 1955, Ruth Ellis was hanged for killing her abusive partner. Her case became one of the catalysts for abolishing the death penalty in the UK, and 70 years later her family is seeking a posthumous pardon.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Ukrainian drones set fire to Russian oil depot after Moscow launches new hypersonic missile
item.description: The strike comes a day after Russia bombarded Ukraine with hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles, including a powerful new hypersonic missile that hit western Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
The strike comes a day after Russia bombarded Ukraine with hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles, including a powerful new hypersonic missile that hit western Ukraine.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A human rights expert explains the status of human rights under the Maduro regime
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Ofelia Riquezes, human rights lawyer and professor at Florida International University, about the status of human rights under the Maduro regime in Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with Ofelia Riquezes, human rights lawyer and professor at Florida International University, about the status of human rights under the Maduro regime in Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Why is Russia reserved in its response to the U.S. attack on Venezuela?
item.description: Despite a close relationship with Caracas stretching back for decades, Russia has been reserved in its response to the U.S. attack on Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: Despite a close relationship with Caracas stretching back for decades, Russia has been reserved in its response to the U.S. attack on Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Trump quiere que petroleras estadounidenses lleguen a Venezuela. Esto es lo que usted debe saber
item.description: El Presidente Donald Trump quiere que más compañías petroleras estadounidenses se incorporen a Venezuela. Pero existen razones económicas e históricas que podrían dificultar su acceso.
item.content:encoded:
El Presidente Donald Trump quiere que más compañías petroleras estadounidenses se incorporen a Venezuela. Pero existen razones económicas e históricas que podrían dificultar su acceso.

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: How are Greenlanders responding to Trump's threats to acquire the territory?
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks to Naaja Nathanielsen, a government minister in Greenland, about President Trump's latest threats to buy or acquire the territory, and how Greenlanders are responding.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks to Naaja Nathanielsen, a government minister in Greenland, about President Trump's latest threats to buy or acquire the territory, and how Greenlanders are responding.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug
